channel.title: Vote Data?
channel.description: So you know how rsps vote sites display how many votes you have gotten? How could I get that data from each of them and put it in a php script of my own and call it. Like maybe on the webclient page have a little ticker with current votes from X sites, and have it update each time a new vote is added. Just having the basic totals would work too :P This could also be called in to the game, if done correctly.

item.title: Vote Data?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Pwnd:

Do you understand then?

Not exactly no I’m not the best at grabbing web data.

Read full topic

item.title: Vote Data?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“RSCShadow, post:4, topic:525959”]Are you talking about scraping content from a vote website? If you’re lucky, they may provide you with an API to do so (a page that returns JSON or something similar), otherwise you’re going to have to use an HTML parser and get it the hard way.

Since you mentioned PHP, http://stackoverflow.com/questions/3577641/how-do-you-parse-and-process-html-xml-in-php[/quote]
Yeah, I think. Like if you go to the moparscape server status page and look in the sponsored servers section, See where column where it says votes and it has like +48667 and such? 48667 is what I’d like to put in my site, where ever I please. Same with other vote pages.

Read full topic

item.title: Vote Data?
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

This wouldn’t be a difficult task for you, the programmer. Your server may have a different opinion, however. Especially if you’re scraping the data each time you want to see it. (Unless provided an XML or JSON alternative… )The process would include you downloading the data of each page, sifting through it till you found your data, then displaying it on your website/page/whatever.

Read full topic

item.title: Vote Data?
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

Are you talking about scraping content from a vote website? If you’re lucky, they may provide you with an API to do so (a page that returns JSON or something similar), otherwise you’re going to have to use an HTML parser and get it the hard way.

Since you mentioned PHP, http://stackoverflow.com/questions/3577641/how-do-you-parse-and-process-html-xml-in-php

Read full topic

item.title: Vote Data?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Uncalled:

It would be quite simple, actually. Create a variable, or maybe do it via db, and call the data from said PHP file and display it with HTML.

Yeah but I don’t know how to get the actual data, i wouldn’t have a clue what it’d be named

Read full topic
